title: I managed to right click a ranged champion in lane as a melee
body: And my reward for my masterful positioning to pull off such a feat? I lose 20% of my health to minions and another 10% from a few enemy autos as I furiously retreat to a bush or out of minion aggro range. I was definitely outplayed.

Getting real tired of hearing melee tops complain about ranged tops... Like the game needs to be balanced around top melee champs. Just because you think the meta is "tanky melee top" does not mean Riot needs to nerf all ranged champs or buff all melee champs.

The trade off is that  most ranged champs in top are super squishy and can have a negative impact on the team comp (too much AD, not enough tank, etc) So all you have to do as a tanky melee is just farm and not bother trying to engage a ranged champ. Mid/late game you will be too tanky for a  ranged to solo you anyway. As long as you didn't feed them 5 kills prior.

Melee top is literally the most brainless grind role I've ever witnessed. You just literally farm for 20 minutes and then walk through the enemy team like a diamond skinned potato.

You wanna know how you beat ranged vs melee? You get jungler to gank, then you have free farm and you're ahead in kills/assists.

But no, you want to be able to walk through all the AAs and go right up to the ranged champ and then pound them with your fists until they are dead and you are the greatest potato of all time. What you really want is to not even have any sort of challenge against ranged champs... You just want another potato melee top laner to lane against so you can both farm in peace and occasionally slap fight each other for 30 seconds before walking away to heal.

When people say melees coast off of base stats, they refer to bruisers. Because bruisers no matter how you slice it are pseudo casters, even Jax and Irelia fit that bill. They don't pure DPS with crit and armor pen, so naturally the base damage on their abilities are higher because they depend on those abilities more than they do their auto attacks. Ranged adcs typically have lower base damages on abilities or simply lack rotation in spells (thus lower based damages on abilities) because of how they tend to build. So yes, of course bruisers will rely more on base damages. And when people who play squishy champions complain about base damage bruisers killing them, my reply is simple: base offense is beating base defense because we know adcs aren't itemizing past 1 defensive item. I would say the same for mages but they randomly get mr, armor and health galore thrown into their items with amazing utility and CDR.
